Company: New York-Presbyterian Hospital, Weill Cornell Medical Center
Description of incident: An admissions employee is accused              of selling 2,000 patients' data in an identity theft scheme and accessing              nearly 50,000 records illegitimately. Records contained names, phone              numbers and, in some cases, Social Security numbers of patients. The              employee has since been charged with one count of conspiracy involving              computer fraud, identity document fraud, transmission of stolen property              and sale of stolen property.
